questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You create a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You plan to deploy Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise applications to all the client computers at your company.
You prepare the following XML file for the planned deployment.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1:
Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise feature updates will be installed once every six months.
The Channel element in the configuration file is set to 'Targeted'. This means Semi-Annual Targeted.
To help your organization prepare for a Semi-Annual Channel release, Microsoft provides Semi-Annual Channel (Targeted). The primary purpose of this update channel is to give pilot users and application compatibility testers in your organization a chance to work with the upcoming Semi-Annual Channel release
Box 2:
Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise security updates will be installed every six months in March and September.
A Semi-Annual Channel (Targeted) release with new features is expected to be released twice a year, in March and September.
The March and September feature releases for Semi-Annual Channel (Targeted) also include security and non-security updates that have been released previously in Monthly Channel.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/configuration-options-for-the-office-2016-deployment-tool#updates-element https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-of-update-channels-for-office-365-proplus

discussion.content:
Box 2 is incorrect Security updates are applied every month no matter what channel you choose 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-update-channels
Wrong Box B. Security Updates every month.

From: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/update-channels-changes

Update channel New attribute value Previous attribute value

comments.content: After June 9, 2020, previous attribute values for each update channel will still be valid. For example, if you use Broad in your configuration XML file, Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel will be installed. We're keeping the previous attribute values valid so that you don't have to update your existing configuration XML files.

discussion.content:
FEATURE update - once every 6 months (Jan and July)
SECURITY update - once a month
Outdated question, better skip this one.

1 - every six months for semi-annual
2 - security updates happen every month for any channel

Security every month
Feature jan and july
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/update-channels-changes#office-deployment-tool

Actually the file definition for channels is wrong in terms of Broad, 
BOX 2 must be set to monthly 

Channel="BetaChannel"
Channel="CurrentPreview"
Channel="Current"
Channel="MonthlyEnterprise"
Channel="SemiAnnualPreview"
Channel="SemiAnnual"

Semi-Annual Enterprise Channel previously was know as Broad
In addition to new features, update channels provide, as needed, security and non-security updates on a regular basis, every month. Once a month, on the second Tuesday of the month

Reference

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/update-channels-changes
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-update-channels#semi-annual-enterprise-channel-overview

As for Channel, it seems to have been changed to SemiAnnualPreview.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/update-channels-changes#office-deployment-tool

choices.C: Skype for Business Server Remote Connectivity Test

discussion.content: In exam today

Selected Answer: B
From: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/network-planner

Network Planner is a new tool that is available in the Teams admin center. It can be found by going to Planning > Network planner. In just a few steps, the Network Planner can help you determine and organize network requirements for connecting Microsoft Teams users across your organization. When you provide your network details and Teams usage, the Network Planner calculates your network requirements for deploying Teams and cloud voice across your organization's physical locations.

questions.question_text:
You plan to deploy Microsoft Teams to 2,500 users.
You need to estimate the internet bandwidth required for the deployment.
What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
is C because other devices already have office and is set to not uninstall other version

Correct: because, You can install the 32-bit version on both 32-bit and 64-bit devices, but you can install the 64-bit version on 64-bit devices only.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/apps-add-office365

comments.content: Remove other versions is set to no, so answer is C.

If Office 2016 have been installed with the MSI package, not sure that Office 365 will install. I guessed you tested with the C2R install of Office 2016? Some informations are missing to answer accurately...

discussion.content:
B,
you can have both Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Office 2016 or 2019 installed on the same computer (Tested).
Whilst, the CPU version wont effect as 32 bit is compatible with both x64 and x86.

you're, Welcome :)

Selected Answer: C
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/apps-add-office365#before-you-start

If there are .msi Office apps on the end-user device, you must use the Remove MSI feature to safely uninstall these apps. Otherwise, the Intune delivered Microsoft 365 apps will fail to install.

Selected Answer: B
This is about an App Configuration Policy in the Endpoint Management portal. It does define the apps that will be installed. It is recommended that existing MSI versions of Office apps are uninstalled, but the option exists to keep them. That does not mean that the Office 365 apps are not installed in this case!

I looked at this in practice - and also found this source: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/upgrade-from-msi-version

Remove other versions: Choose Yes to remove other versions of Office (MSI) from user devices. Choose this option when you want to remove pre-existing Office .MSI apps from end-user devices. The installation won't succeed if there are pre-existing .MSI apps on end-user devices. The apps to be uninstalled are not limited to the apps selected for installation in Configure App Suite, as it will remove all Office (MSI) apps from the end user device. For more information, see Remove existing MSI versions of Office when upgrading to Microsoft 365 Apps. When Intune reinstalls Office on your end user's machines, end users will automatically get the same language packs that they had with previous .MSI Office installations. 

RemoveMSI can be used to uninstall 2007, 2010, 2013, or 2016 versions of Office, Visio, or Project that were installed using Windows Installer (MSI).

choices.B: Custom role based access control (RBAC) roles
choices.A: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Privileged Identity Management (PIM)
choices.C: Administrative units in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)
choices.D: Privileged access management for Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Administrative units restrict permissions in a role to any portion of your organization that you define. You could, for example, use administrative units to delegate the Helpdesk Administrator role to regional support specialists, so they can manage users only in the region that they support.
Source: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/roles/administrative-units

Selected Answer: C
This is what administrative units are for

Selected Answer: C
C: Administrative units

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct one

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/roles/administrative-units

Answer is C: Administrative units in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)
Refer: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/roles/administrative-units

questions.question_text:
Your company has a single Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.
The company has five departments that each has a dedicated helpdesk operator.
You need to ensure that the helpdesk operators can manage only the users in their respective department.
What should you use?

choices.A: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, configure a Service health email notification.
choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 Defender portal, create an alert policy and configure an email notification.
choices.B: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, configure a Message center email notification.
choices.D: From the Exchange admin center, create an alert policy and configure an email notification.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
answer: A

comments.content: I can confirm this, tested it in practice.

discussion.content:
How come the answer is not A
It's called “Service notifications in email”.
Go to the Microsoft 365 admin center and select “Service Health” or click here.
Select Preferences.
Enter the email address where the notifications need to go (Max of 2 addresses), select the notification issues and the services you want to be notified about.

Selected Answer: A
Microsoft 365 admin center -> Health -> Service health -> Customize -> Email

Selected Answer: A
A without doubt

Selected Answer: C
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/view-service-health?view=o365-worldwide

Selected Answer: A
answer: A

it is A
https://office365itpros.com/2019/11/26/email-notifications-when-office-365-services-break/

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a group named Group1.
You need to ensure that all the members of Group1 are notified when Microsoft 365 outages occur. The solution must minimize administrative effort.
What should you do?
